subject: AI
title: Output Filtering
description: Catching harmful outputs before they reach users.

hook.text: Your chatbot generates a response that includes a customer's credit card number from the training data. It reaches the user's screen before anyone notices.

buildup.text: Output filtering scans the model's response before delivery: regex for PII (credit cards, SSNs, emails), classification models for harmful content, and business rule checks.

discovery.text: Layer filters: (1) Pattern matching for PII, (2) Content safety classifier for harmful/toxic output, (3) Business rules (never mention competitors, never make promises about SLAs).

twist.text: Overly strict filtering creates a bad experience: blocking legitimate medical questions because they contain 'sensitive' keywords. Tune filters to your domain â€” a healthcare bot needs different rules than a shopping bot.

climax.text: Filter outputs, not just inputs. The model might generate harmful content even from innocent queries. Defense at the output layer is your last line of protection.

punchline.text: Trust the model to be helpful. Verify the output before it reaches the user.

quiz.question: Why is output filtering important even when input filtering exists?
options: The model might generate harmful content from innocent queries, so the output is the last checkpoint
Output filtering is only for logging
